comment.author: 54149265@N02
comment._content: Wow, I love these ancient photos

comment.author: 21624712@N07
comment._content:
There must be multiple Cricketer's Arms Hotels. I remember one on the corner of Cleveland and Dowling Streets, Surry Hills and I notice there is a current Cricketer's Arms Hotel in Fitzroy Street, Surry Hills.

The hotel in the above photo seems to be now known as The Abbott's Hotel and has been much extended and the facade modified.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/corinneski] Abbott's Hotel is on the North East corner (see streetview above). I had another look, and wouldn't you know it, there used to be a hotel on the North West corner, which is still named "Cricketer's Arms" in the top plasterwork - see different GoogleMapsStreetView - goo.gl/maps/OS6vn That makes sense when you look at the layout of the tramways (on three streets, not four) on this c.1928 map at full size - the Cricketer's Arms is marked as Hannam's Hotel. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/6662642331/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: There's another print of this image in the SLNSW - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=178668 - dated November 1926 and "resumption". I think the old hotel was resumed shortly after this photo to enable a tramway corner (see map above). Then the new hotel was built slightly back (see satellite photo). Just to confuse things further a revised equivalent GoogleMapsStreetView - goo.gl/maps/TeqGx

comment._content: Isn't there the Bat and Ball hotel on the corner of cleveland street ?
